dt: {bc}a {a_link|trembling} or shaking usually from physical weakness, emotional stress, or disease
{bc}a discrete small movement following or preceding a major seismic event

et: Middle English {it}tremour{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}tremor{/it}, from Latin, from {it}tremere{/it}
shortdef: a trembling or shaking usually from physical weakness, emotional stress, or disease
a quivering or vibratory motion; especially : a discrete small movement following or preceding a major seismic event
